options.description: Server url hosting Beacon Node APIs to fetch weak subjectivity state. Fetch latest finalized by default, else set --wssCheckpoint
File path or url to finalized checkpoint state to start syncing from

Start beacon node off a state at the provided weak subjectivity checkpoint, to be supplied in <blockRoot>:<epoch> format. For example, 0x1234:100 will sync and start off from the weak subjectivity state at checkpoint of epoch 100 with block root 0x1234.
Force syncing from checkpoint state even if db state is within weak subjectivity period. This helps to avoid long sync times after node has been offline for a while.

Ignore the checkpoint sync state failing the weak subjectivity check. This is relevant in testnets where the weak subjectivity period is too small for even few epochs of non finalization causing last finalized to be out of range. This flag is not recommended for mainnet use.

Flag to SSE emit execution `payloadAttributes` before every slot

name: lodestar
raw_help_text:
🌟 Lodestar: TypeScript Implementation of the Ethereum Consensus Beacon Chain.

 * Version: v1.40.0/206f3bb
  * by ChainSafe Systems, 2018-2026

Commands:
  beacon       Run a beacon chain node
  validator    Run one or multiple validator clients
  lightclient  Run lightclient
  dev          Quickly bootstrap a beacon node and multiple validators. Use for
               development and testing
  bootnode     Run a discv5 bootnode. This will NOT perform any beacon node func
               tions, rather, it will run a discv5 service that allows nodes on
               the network to discover one another.

Options:
      --dataDir        Lodestar root data directory                     [string]
      --network        Name of the Ethereum Consensus chain network to join
  [string] [choices: "mainnet", "gnosis", "sepolia", "hoodi", "chiado", "ephemer
                                                   y", "dev"] [default: mainnet]
      --paramsFile     Network configuration file                       [string]
      --rcConfig       RC file to supplement command line args, accepted formats
                       : .yml, .yaml, .json                             [string]
      --supernode      Subscribe to and custody all data column sidecar subnets
                                                                       [boolean]
      --semiSupernode  Subscribe to and custody half of the data column sidecar
                       subnets to support blob reconstruction, enabling more eff
                       icient data availability with lower bandwidth and storage
                        requirements compared to a supernode.          [boolean]
  -h, --help           Show help                                       [boolean]
  -v, --version        Show version number                             [boolean]
